result.execSummary:
The defendant Emma L Ryder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 20 days.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

01:56 PM Defendant Thomas D Bender in court with attorney J Andrew Herbers.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Herbers requests an adjournment as the defendant needs time to do counseling.  Court will allow an adjournment until September. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Walmart/Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key. 02:59 PM Defendant Emma L Ryder in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
